results.title: Balzac
results.creator_credit: Jean Vidal, AE Films and Les Films du Compas
results.brief_description: Contemporary paintings, manuscripts and lithographs are used in this film depicting the life of Balzac, nineteenth century French novelist. Beginning with shots of the workroom in which Balzac wrote many of his novels, the film flashes back to the Napoleonic era during which the writer was born. The film traces his boyhood, his career, the mounting of his debts, his love affairs, and concludes with his death which came after he had recreated a whole society in his ninety-six novels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Vidal, AE Films and Les Films du Compas

results.title: The Baltimore plan
results.brief_description: Explains how a young social worker aroused the interest of citizens, government officials, and a local newspaper in the housing conditions in Baltimore’s slums. Describes the “Baltimore Plan” which made minimum housing standards a legal requirement and which created a Housing Court to enforce the laws. Shows how officials and citizens in Baltimore attacked the problem in selected areas. No other credits available.

results.title: The Baltic story
results.creator_credit: Gordon Bradley and Gordon Bradley Ltd
results.brief_description: Produced for the Baltimore Mercantile and Shipping Exchange, this film describes the world-wide activities of the Baltic Exchange. This is the international centre for the chartering of ships and aircraft - a vast clearing house where carriers are found for cargo and cargo for carriers - to and from any port in the world. The Baltic has the distinction of being the world’s only shipping exchange. Narrated by John Le Mesurier the film features the work of a broker, John Hall, during a day at the exchange.

results.title: Balmain
results.creator_credit: Kit Guyatt and Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative
results.brief_description: Expresses the popular protest of residents in the inner Sydney suburb of Balmain against the industrial development of the foreshore as a major container shipping port. Discusses the historic buildings and traditional character of the area and the radical changes expected. Shows the problems of the city planning involved.

results.title: Ball on vole
results.brief_description: The apparently aimless flight of a ball which goes out of reach and wanders where it will, is presented in a series of amusing incidents and co-incidences as five boys try to capture it. Drama follows its appearance wherever it goes, people are bumped and shot, and it eludes them to the end. A whimsical film with a unique sense of humour.

results.title: Balloon goes up
results.brief_description: During the reign of King Louis XVI, the Motgolfier brothers invented the hot air balloon. Pierre Olaf narrates an animated account of the balloon flight in which the first living creatures, a duck, a sheep, and a rooster, were sent aloft in Versailles, France. No other credits available.

results.title: Ballet with Edward Villella
results.creator_credit: William Francisco, Robert Saudek and Learning Corporation of America
results.brief_description: Edward Villella, lead dancer with the New York City Ballet, dissolves the notion that male dancers are ‘sissified’ in a montage of dances demonstrating the muscular control necessary in his art. Shows how the body is made into a smoothly working organism while expressing ideas and feelings. Includes excerpts from NYC Ballet productions.

results.title: Ballet in New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Robert Lapresle, Cyril Morton, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The standard of ballet in New Zealand is shown in excerpts from four works - ‘Napoli’, ‘Do-wack-a-do’, ‘Les Sylphides’, ‘Prismatic variations’. A good representative selection which shows competence, imagination and enthusiasm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lapresle, Cyril Morton, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Ballet girl
results.brief_description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.
results.description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.

results.title: Ballet adagio
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A slow motion study by Norman McLaren of the pas-de-deux adagio, one of the most exacting and difficult dances of the classical ballet. A ballet originally choreographed by the Russian ballet master Asaf Messerer is performed in this film by the internationally known Canadian pair David and Anna Marie Holmes, to the music of Albinoni’s “Adagio”. A film to heighten the aesthetic appreciation of classical ballet and to afford observation of the technique and mechanics of the adagio movements. Photographed by Jaques Fogel and Douglas Kiefer. (Awards: Melbourne, Atlanta, Columbus, Bogota)
